Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: theresa m
Reviews.Content: Our car was in a parking lot downtown and closed overnight, so we had to walk/ taxi around finding a cheap hotel at 4 am. When we got there, we paid up front and was walked to our room to find there was only a door handle and the key lock above the handle was GONE and you can completely see inside! I said this was unacceptable and the guy acted like it was no big deal, he said he would bring tape to cover it up, never brought the tape back. There was a dead cockroach in the bathroom. When we got into bed, I couldn't sleep and 2 hours later we just got our stuff and left. Total for a room there was $99 and they expect you to have a door with a hole in it so people can peep in!? Unbelievable. I will be calling the manager today to get money back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible accommodation, Horrible neighbors!”
Reviews.Author: magnet10
Reviews.Content: renovated with new furniture but dirty and stains all over the bed. you can hear foot steps upstairs not to mention the next door. you may be trouble sleeping if you have wrong neighbors like i did. They said to pay in advance at check in and no refund. i wondered why.

Reviews.Title: “The value for the price is Right”
Reviews.Author: Gordon M
Reviews.Content: The manager of the hotel was one of the reasons that made my stay worth while. Andrew Helsper was very accommodating. I ask for a microwave. He made it happen. I asked for an iron and ironing board. He made it happen. A very helpful, friendly man. I came to SD and did not want to rent a car and just rely on the Trolly. The SD Downtown Lodge is only two blocks from a trolly stop. The hotel location made that totally possible. The maid service was great. Every time I came back to my room, everything was tidy and in order. It looked like the hotel was a recently renovated. That gave the room a clean and fresh feel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tappers1984
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place. Here are a list of reasons why you should not stay at downtown San diego lodge: 1) On check in I had to pay more money than expected because the hotel added on extra tax plus I had already paid for the first night as a deposit which they apparently said I hadn't (even tho it had come out of my bank and I had it on my reservation papers). So i had to pay again. 2) our first room had a faulty lock and they only way we could get in was to ask reception to let us in. we slept with our cases and a bedside table against the door as we backed onto a road and didn't feel safe with a faulty lock. 3) we switched rooms because of the lock and because a group of lads next door were up all night fighting and banging on doors. Both rooms were dirty, the bathrooms especially. They were in the middle of a revamp and there was dust everywhere, wires hanging out the walls, no curtains in our second room and the air conditioning unit had half the front missing 4) there was no hot water. 5) the cleaner stole my shampoo and conditioner then admitted it to the manager when I confronted them (altho the manager was lovely and gave me some money to buy more) 6)one member of staff (receptionist) was rude and wasn't very helpful altho I couldn't fault the manager. 7) it's not good value for money. If your a group of lads looking for a place to kip after a night out then this is the place for you, altho a premier inn is just as cheap and a damn sight nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Horable esablishment with blood, roaches, bums”
Reviews.Author: dellinside
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under what looked to be some construction, we were told we were getting an upgraded room, but there were dirty raisers in the bathroom, bottle caps in the ac, roaches in the sink and on the floor.... and when we brought all this to thehotel mgr he said, what's the problem? We had to fight to get a full refund....

Reviews.Title: “Total ripoff!”
Reviews.Author: mfrost223
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to stay here based on the reviews below, and it was fourth of july weekend so we didnt have much choice. We arrived to a major dissapointment, we were totally shafted when it cost $150 to stay in this hotel and its completely run down. Our room looked like it was in the middle of renovations, all our furniture was disheveled. There was absolutely no facilities or real accommodations at all. It looked like a bomb hit it, literally. Unfinished construction, in which case the room should have costed no more than fifty bux for the night, if even that!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place!”
Reviews.Author: Cooper71
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here! This place doesn't give you value for your money. We were on a budget and decided online to stay here and made a reservation. The reviews were quite positive, so seemed the price together with the photos. The guy who checked us in asked nicely the required rates, but put far too much tax on it (18%). We were unaware of the rates for San Diego, so we paid it. The room he gave us was the worst we ever had. It was small, but we could expect that for a rate of $ 60 in downtown San Diego. The bathroom was dirty, with hair of someone else in the shower and in the (clean?) towels and a door that could barely open because it was clashing against the toilet. But the worst of all was the smell, like ten dogs had been sleeping there for a long time. As a result, the sheets also smelled and looked, together with the towels, more yellow than white. We didn't get enough of sleep due to the disgusting conditions of our room, the bathroom light, which switched on and off during the night by itself and the noisy neighborhood, like people are scoring crack outside. We saw the reviews below and thought it would be a nice place, but didn't realize they are outdated. So here is an update: get away from this horrible place! Spend some extra for a better place where you will sleep well!

Reviews.Title: “san diego”
Reviews.Author: kulfred
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. great location. across the the street from the hotel is a nice authentic italian resteraunt. right up the street from the house of blues, the gaslamp district, and plenty of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: 1Houstontravler
Reviews.Content: By not booking in advance I ended up at the Downtown Lodge and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and refreshing. the price was very competitive and the staff friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. I would never reccommend it. Do not stay here even if the other hotels are booked or only have the higher rate rooms available...it is uncomfortable. You will regret it, we do. We tried to get our money back within 10 minutes of check-in, we didn't even receive a part of it or some sort of empathy from the management staff. Management was very rude, he would not even listen to us. The hotel gives off a very bad vibe and the room is dirty, it has stains in the carpet among other things. We did not stay the night and left. Again, do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The price was cheap, and rightly so! Very loud. Situated between an on-ramp and an on-ramp so no wonder. Without earplugs, good luck. Staff was nice, and were willing to let us check out a day early (we found a room for the same price via 3rd party Internet site...much better). Room was clean, but very worn. All linen needs replacement. Parking is very limited, and though we did walk to the Gaslamp district it didn't seem like a great place to be walking around. Bottom line: If you don't want to pay much, and all you want a room over your head, this may be your place.

Reviews.Title: “hear traffic noise, far from gaslamp, didn't feel safe, room was old”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to drive to San Diego for the weekend (1/14/04) and Travelodge was the only motel with vacancies. well no wonder, for $89/night, you can hear the cars/trucks passing by, there's a gate that didn't lock properly, there was minimal parking (but it's free if you find a spot), room was old, ragedy carpet, phone didn't work. I was glad there was hot water, a small bar of soap and shampoo. i wouldn't stay there again. go to the comfort inn or best western up the street. unfortunately, they were fully booked when we went. It's a few minutes drive to gaslamp district but you need a car to get around San Diego county anyway.

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego Downtown Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 1345 10th Ave, San Diego, CA 92101
